name: Vegan Rabri - Indian Milk Pudding
description: For an easy yet impressive holiday dessert try my vegan spin on Indian rabri,  a thick, creamy milk pudding. My vegan rabri recipe is made with nut milk and flavored with cardamom and saffron.  Gluten-free and soy-free.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup raw cashews (soaked in warm water for 15 mins)
1 1/4 cups water (2 cups of water if you like you rabri a bit thinner)
1 to 2 tablespoons chopped raw pistachios or chopped pistachios and almonds for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Blend the coconut milk, oat milk, cashews, pistachios, water, saffron , seeds of the cardamom pod until well blended.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend the coconut milk, oat milk, cashews, pistachios, water, saffron , seeds of the cardamom pod until well blended.

recipeInstructions.text: I usually blend it for a minute then let the mixture sit for 5 minutes for the nuts to rehydrate. Then I blend again for 30 seconds and I do this again once or twice until the mixture is incredibly smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Add this mixture to a saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil stirring occasionally.
recipeInstructions.name: Add this mixture to a saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil stirring occasionally.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in your almond flour, salt, and sugar and mix in the mixture. After it has come to a boil, the mixture will tend to thicken and stick to the sides. So keep stirring.

recipeInstructions.text: Reduce the heat to medium-low. Let the mixture dry a little bit on the edges and then mix it in after half a minute and continue to cook for another 3-4 minutes this way or until the mixture is thickened to preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Take off heat. Let it cool for a few minutes. Let a film form over the mixture, mix that and repeat this a couple of times until the mixture is just about lukewarm.

recipeInstructions.text: Then transfer it to your serving bowls. Top it with the pistachios and almonds and serve as is or chill and serve.
